questions.question: Input the identity matrix of size 2x2.
If matrix A is \( \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 0 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \), input the transpose of A.
Enter a 3x3 matrix where the diagonal elements are 2 and all other elements are 0.
If matrix B is \( \begin{bmatrix} 3 & -2 \\ 5 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \), input the result of multiplying B by 2.
Input a 2x3 matrix with elements arranged in ascending order from 1 to 6.
Enter the inverse of the matrix \( \begin{bmatrix} 4 & 7 \\ 2 & 6 \end{bmatrix} \). (Round each element to two decimal places if needed.)
Enter a 4x4 matrix with the main diagonal as 1s and all other elements as 0.
If matrix C is \( \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix} \), input the transpose of C.
Determine the determinant of the matrix \( \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \).
